thread.title: Ramblers lose opener at Canadian Intermediate Little League event | PNI Atlantic News
thread.title_full: Ramblers lose opener at Canadian Intermediate Little League event | PNI Atlantic News

author: Jeremy Fraser
title: Ramblers lose opener at Canadian Intermediate Little League event | PNI Atlantic News
text:
Sydney Mines Ramblers open Canadian Intermediate Little League Championship with loss to Ontario
The Sydney Mines Ramblers began their quest for the Canadian Intermediate Little League Championship title with a loss on Wednesday.
Sydney Mines was defeated 7-3 by Ottawa West, representing Ontario at the tournament, at Crickett Field in Kingston, Ont. The score was 4-3 going into the final inning.
Ethan Marche and Jack O’Connell each had two singles while Ethan LeRue had a double, and Gavin Gillis added a single for the Ramblers.
Leo Gallant and O’Connell pitched for the Sydney Mines club.
Statistics for Ottawa West were not available.
Sydney Mines will continue the tournament on Thursday when they face Alberta at 11:30 a.m., Atlantic time.
The tournament semifinals are slated for Tuesday at 11:30 a.m. and 3 p.m. The consolation and championship games will be played on Wednesday at 10 a.m., and 1 p.m., respectively.
The winner of the national tournament will advance to the intermediate Little League World Series, scheduled for July 27 to Aug. 3 in Livermore, Calif.
